title.value: Assessing the quality and value of metabolic chart data for capturing core outcomes for pediatric medium-chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase (MCAD) deficiency
title.justification: The title clearly represents the main focus of the study, which is to assess the quality and value of metabolic chart data in capturing outcomes for pediatric MCAD deficiency.
title.quote: Assessing the quality and value of metabolic chart data for capturing core outcomes for pediatric medium-chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase (MCAD) deficiency

extractions.description: This paper evaluates the quality of metabolic chart data and its suitability for measuring core outcomes in children with medium-chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase (MCAD) deficiency. It uses cohort data from a Canadian study to analyze the frequency of clinic visits and data quality concerning outcomes such as emergency department use, fasting time, metabolic decompensation, and death. The findings highlight a need for standardized documentation and improved data capture methods.

type.justification: The study uses real-world data from cohort studies to analyze and evaluate data quality and capture methods, showcasing empirical research methodology.
type.quote: We used existing cohort data abstracted from charts of 124 children diagnosed with MCAD deficiency who participated in a Canadian study...

name.justification: The study primarily revolves around the quality assessment and data capture in clinical settings, which are key concerns in Health Informatics.
name.quote: To improve care and long-term outcomes for children with MCAD deficiency, rigorous approaches to evaluation of treatments are needed, informed by reliable, sustainable, and longitudinal measurement of clinically meaningful and patient-centred outcomes.

name.justification: The study is centered on pediatric MCAD deficiency.
name.quote: Assessing the quality and value of metabolic chart data for capturing core outcomes for pediatric medium-chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase (MCAD) deficiency

name.justification: The paper focuses on medium-chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase deficiency, a specific type of metabolic disorder.
name.quote: The mitochondrial fatty acid oxidation disorder, medium-chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase (MCAD) deficiency, is one of the most common inherited metabolic diseases...
